parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
Genitive case of an interrogative pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place; at what locality.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.
An adversary, Satan. Of Chaldee origin corresponding to ma'bad; the accuser, i.e. The devil.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
Antipas, a Christian martyr of Pergamum. Contracted for a compound of anti and a derivative of pater; Antipas, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
An adversary, Satan. Of Chaldee origin corresponding to ma'bad; the accuser, i.e. The devil.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
